They watched in horror as the four adults in their raft lost their lives. It is suspected that a malfunction with the ride's conveyor belt caused the six-person raft to flip, resulting in the crushing and drowning of two men, aged 38 and 35, and two women, aged 42 and 32, around 2:20 pm on Tuesday. The victims include Kate Goodchild, 32, from Canberra, her brother Luke Dorsett, 35, his partner Roozi Araghi, 38, and another woman. The fourth victim has been identified as Cindy Low, 42, from Kawerau, by the New Zealand Herald. This event has left me deeply saddened.
